io.github.nikmang.stevecoin.utils

Enum CryptoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<CryptoUtils>
      • io.github.nikmang.stevecoin.utils.CryptoUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CryptoUtils>

    public enum CryptoUtils
extends java.lang.Enum<CryptoUtils>
    A utility class that contains some convenience methods to se in the crypto package.

    This binary table is for plugin use only, to speed up block creation.
    The values are skewed to favour block creation so actual binary results will differ.
    Taken from tutorial source listed in README.md.

      • getBinaryString

        public java.lang.String getBinaryString(java.lang.String input)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • signECDSA

        public byte[] signECDSA(java.security.PrivateKey pKey,
                        java.lang.String toSign)
                 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Sign a string using ECDSA.
        Parameters:
        pKey - PrivateKey of signer.
        toSign - The string to be signed.
        Returns:
        null if exception occurs. Signed bytes of the string.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - If private key provided was invalid.

      • verifyECDSA

        public boolean verifyECDSA(java.security.PublicKey pKey,
                           java.lang.String data,
                           byte[] signature)
                    throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Attempts to verify data using ECDSA.
        Parameters:
        pKey - PublicKey of a user.
        data - The data to be verified.
        signature - The signature that was used to sign the data.
        Returns:
        true if successfully verified. false if verification is wrong or exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - If public key provided was invalid.

      • getMerkleRoot

        public java.lang.String getMerkleRoot(java.util.List<Transaction> transactions)
        Gets the merkle root for a list of transactions.
        Parameters:
        transactions - List of transactions from which to generate the root.
        Returns:
        The String representation of the merkle root.
